unnormalised: **Automotive News: A Look at Recent Vehicle Launches and Trends**
normalised: **Automotive News: A Look at Recent Vehicle Launches and Trends**

unnormalised: The Indian automotive market continues to see exciting developments, with several recent vehicle launches showcasing innovative technologies and designs. Dr. APJ Abdul Kalam Automotive Research Institute recently published a paper highlighting the increasing focus on fuel efficiency across various segments.
normalised: The Indian automotive market continues to see exciting developments, with several recent vehicle launches showcasing innovative technologies and designs. Doctor A P J Abdul Kalam Automotive Research Institute recently published a paper highlighting the increasing focus on fuel efficiency across various segments.

unnormalised: Mahindra & Mahindra unveiled their new XUV900, boasting a redesigned interior and advanced driver-assistance systems. Tata Motors also launched the ‘Nexon EV Max Plus’ with an extended range of 450 km, targeting the growing electric vehicle segment.
normalised: Mahindra and Mahindra unveiled their new X U V nine hundred, boasting a redesigned interior and advanced driver-assistance systems. Tata Motors also launched the ‘Nexon E V Max Plus’ with an extended range of four hundred and fifty kilometer, targeting the growing electric vehicle segment.

unnormalised: Maruti Suzuki introduced a refreshed version of the Alto 800, aiming to maintain its dominance in the entry-level hatchback category. The new model boasts a fuel efficiency of 24.7 kmpl.
normalised: Maruti Suzuki introduced a refreshed version of the Alto eight hundred, aiming to maintain its dominance in the entry-level hatchback category. The new model boasts a fuel efficiency of twenty four point seven kilometer per liter.

unnormalised: Industry experts are observing a surge in demand for SUVs and crossovers, particularly models offering a blend of practicality and style. Several manufacturers are investing heavily in developing connected car technologies and exploring alternative fuel options, including CNG and biofuels, to cater to the diverse needs of the Indian consumer. Expect more launches focused on BS-VI compliant engines and enhanced safety features in the coming months. The average showroom size of these car brands in Delhi is around 5,000 sq ft with some showrooms having a premium lounge for customers who are looking at vehicles costing Rs. 20 Lakhs or more.
normalised: Industry experts are observing a surge in demand for S U V s and crossovers, particularly models offering a blend of practicality and style. Several manufacturers are investing heavily in developing connected car technologies and exploring alternative fuel options, including C N G and biofuels, to cater to the diverse needs of the Indian consumer. Expect more launches focused on B S hyphen V I compliant engines and enhanced safety features in the coming months. The average showroom size of these car brands in Delhi is around five thousand square feet with some showrooms having a premium lounge for customers who are looking at vehicles costing rupee twenty lakhs or more.
